issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When I try to registered a CloudFormation service on the host where there is no CLC/DB present, it throws following error,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca_conf --register-service -T CloudFormation -H 10.111.1.12 -N API_12
error: registration failed
ERROR	Registering  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_12:cloudformation:API_12/  failed because of  CloudFormationServiceBuilder: registration failed with message: Service configuration storing failed for: [CloudFormationConfiguration partition=API_12 name=API_12 hostName=10.111.1.12 port=8773 servicePath=/services/CloudFormation id=8aef818b46443d300146670fa77f48dd version=0 creationTimestamp=Wed Jun 04 06:26:57 PDT 2014 lastUpdateTimestamp=Wed Jun 04 06:26:57 PDT 2014 naturalId=c9d3edfa-cdd9-402b-991f-a10f40970071]
{noformat}

But when I register on the same host with CLC/DB, registration works fine.
fields.summary: CloudFormation can only be registered on CLC/DB host
fields.environment:
1x CLC/CC/SC
1x NC/UFS
RiakCS

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.1051.el6

comments.body:
I assume you mean the host provided to the -H option is for user facing services and the euca_conf command is run on the coordinator (the CLC with the enabled eucalyptus service)

It looks like the failure may be due to already having a service registered. Can you reproduce the issue on a clean install using only the steps in the description?

I needed to change the --service-name for cloudformation as in the example API_12 was already used for registering user-api, since all the user-api were registered with same name, so my guess was cfn should be registered with the same name as well.

tested this on 4.0.2 system, worked fine with a different name.
